question: According to an assessment conducted by the National Center of State Courts, to what extent are the state's sentencing guidelines mandatory?

question: Taking into consideration the level of compulsion mandated by the state's sentencing guidelines, are judges compelled to provide written rationale for any sentences departing from the guidelines?

question: Individuals eligible for a post-conviction diversionary program:
answer: Individuals with a history of non-violence, who are convicted of a drug-related offense, and who have a drug or alcohol addiction are eligible for the drug offender treatment program

Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 4103. Definitions. [61 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 4103 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-61/chapter-41/section-4103/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/4EVV-STSH).

question: Individuals eligible for a post-conviction diversionary program:
answer: Individuals convicted of any offense that does not carry a mandatory minimum sentence are eligible for any of the available diversionary programs

question: Is the death penalty allowed by state law?
answer: Yes, but it is restricted by a statewide moratorium effective as of 2015

question: Offenses eligible for a sentence of life without parole:
answer: Three or more convictions of violent offenses, including 3rd degree murder, voluntary manslaughter, aggravated assault, and other offenses
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9714. Sentences for second and subsequent offenses. [42 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9714(a)(2), (g) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-42/chapter-97/section-9714/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/8EP8-GGV2).

question: Offenses eligible for a sentence of life without parole:
answer: Three or more convictions of sex offenses, including sexual abuse of a child, indecent assault, invasion of privacy, and other offenses
citations:
Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9718.2. Sentences for sexual offenders. [42 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9718.2(a)(2) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-42/chapter-97/section-9718.2/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/CYC8-XZ2Q).

question: Offenses eligible for a sentence of life without parole:
answer: A conviction of murder or voluntary manslaughter when the individual has a previous murder conviction

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: A petition or request has been filed and accepted
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The court has ordered or approved an expunction request
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The state police central repository has not received a disposition for the case
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The state police central repository did not record a disposition for the case within 18 months after the arrest, and the court confirms that no action is pending
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The petitioner is at least 70 years old and has not been arrested or faced prosecution for at least 10 years following his or her final release from custody
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The individual has been deceased for at least 3 years
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The petitioner has not been placed in an Accelerated Rehabilitative Disposition program for sex offenses against an individual under 18
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The petitioner is not involved in any pending criminal procedures

question: Circumstances under which a conviction record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):

question: Circumstances under which a conviction record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):

question: Circumstances under which a conviction record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):

citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122(a)(3),(b) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/W6TC-ZB79).

question: Circumstances under which a conviction record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:

question: Penalties that may be imposed for failing to pay court fees:
answer: Incarceration until the court fees are paid, and not exceeding 3 months if the individual is unable to pay
